description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Vadodara" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Vadodara

places.generalDescription: Lukshmi Vilas Palace is a grand 19th-century palace surrounded by beautiful gardens and home to an art museum, concert hall, and zoo. Commissioned in 1890 by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III, the palace was designed by Charles Mant and Robert Chisholm, known for their Indo-Saracenic architecture that blends European and South Asian styles. The sprawling palace is adorned with bronze sculptures by Italian artist Fellici Casorati.

sources.snippet: From the famous dome of the arts faculty to the Laxmi Vilas Palace and Music College near Sursagar, British architect Robert Chisholm gave the erstwhile Baroda state a unique character that still stands out.
sources.shortName: Architect who gave Vadodara its character | Vadodara News

sources.snippet: Mayur Shah, proprietor, MSA India, states, “Vadodara’s Lakshmi Vilas Palace is an architectural marvel and native design styles including arches, columns, jaalis and pinnacles are becoming popular inheritances in modern design. Repercussions of building design without local context must be understood and the hard work of artisans of the past must be understood by the architect.” Incidentally, Vadodara has seen extensive use of local materials and indigenous detailing by several local architects.
sources.shortName: Vadodara vibes: Architects from Gujarat gave interesting insights on the subject of preservation of local heritage & flavour in architecture

sources.snippet: The Lakshmi Vilas Palace, one of the most exquisite homes ever built, is situated between vast gardens, mango orchards, and expansive meadows. The palace is an excellent example of the fusion of Hindu, Mughal, and Gothic architectural forms since it makes use of domes, minarets, and arches. The outside of the palace is decorated with Indo-Saracenic-inspired details like miniature domed “chattris” with finials, cusped arched entrances, and jharokha windows.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

places.name: Laxmi Vilas Palace

reviews.text:
One tym experience kind of thing !!
Palace is itself a unique architecture
Full of amazing interior
Taking pics inside the palace is not allowed
One thing which i liked is that they provide us a audio guide in which ever language we want
& It explains things so nicely.
I think spending 250₹ is worth it !!
Their is a special golf cart provided to visitors at an extra cost of 150₹ pp, which provides us a 1 hour tour to 7-8 different locations inside the campus of palace.

The ticket price for Indian adults is ₹250, which is quite steep compared to other heritage sites. Although the palace itself is architecturally stunning and rich in history, the experience falls short in a few key areas. One of the highlights is the complimentary audio-visual guide provided through a Sony Walkman with multilingual options. It's easy to use and provides a good amount of information about the palace. A complete visit typically takes 1 to 2 hours.

The palace, constructed in 1880, is beautifully designed, with special mentions going to the majestic Durbar Hall and the Armoury Hall. The view of the golf course from outside is particularly impressive. There is also a small canteen and a shopping area within the premises. However, while parts of the palace are well maintained, other aspects such as the fountains and overall visitor facilities are lacking. For the ticket price, one would expect better upkeep and more sections of the palace open to the public.

One major downside is the behavior of the security staff. Many visitors have found the guards to be extremely rude and poorly trained in handling tourists. While discipline is important in protecting a heritage site, their unwelcoming attitude significantly affects the visitor experience. Overall, it's a place worth visiting for those passionate about history, but be prepared for a few disappointments along the way. It's closed on Monday since they have maintenance on that day.

The ticket charges: 250 Rs per Indian adult

During visit you can have Sony Walkman with earphones provided by Palace staff having different languages of selection. It was very convenient and gave us enough information related to the palace and was easy to follow. The audio visual guide was included in the ticket cost and we need not pay anything extra. Overall 1 to 2 hr are required to properly visit this place. The whole palace is constructed in 1880 and the beautifully constructed and designed.

There is small centeen and shopping place inside this place for visitors. The palace is well maintained and good support staff during tour.

places.address: J N Marg, Moti Baug, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001, India

places.generalDescription: The BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir, located in Atladara, Vadodara, is a lavish Hindu temple known for its intricate stone carvings, domes, and beautiful garden adorned with statues of deities. As one of the most significant pilgrimage sites in Gujarat, it attracts visitors seeking spiritual and cultural experiences. The temple complex is dedicated to Lord Swaminarayan and showcases stunning architecture following traditional Hindu temple styles.

sources.snippet: The Vadodara neighbourhood of Atladara is home to the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir. The BAPS Mandir serves as the focal point of several religious and cultural events. Its teachings emphasize Hindu ethics while keeping in mind Indian culture and the importance of family unity.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

places.name: BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir

reviews.text: I visited in night at the time of closing but I almost visit the all things there is mandir and hostel for students with nice architecture and good atmosphere and there canteen is also too good satwik food you get and peace full place good for family and in some places ladies is not allowed to go inside because of some reason but overall good experience

The BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Atladara, Vadodara, is a serene and spiritually enriching destination. The temple's intricate architecture, adorned with hand-carved marble and limestone, reflects traditional Indian craftsmanship and offers a tranquil ambiance for visitors.

The temple is also a hub for cultural and spiritual activities, hosting various events and festivals throughout the year.

Whether you're seeking spiritual solace or appreciating architectural beauty, this mandir offers a fulfilling experience. Highly recommended for all visitors.

Hi friends
* Holistic experience and great place in vadodara's temple, spiritual atmosphere.
* Parking is available.
* In  afternoon mandir close rehta hai.
* Mandir is very beautiful.
* Open and close time 9:00 am to9:00 pm.
* Mandir is very clean.

places.address: Shastri Yagnapurush Marg Swaminarayan mandir, Atladara, Vadodara, Gujarat 390023, India

places.generalDescription: Mandvi Gate is a significant historical site in Vadodara, dating back to the 16th century. It is a square-shaped pavilion with three arched openings on each side and was once used as a toll gate for traders and merchants. The city's original walls may have vanished, but Mandvi Gate still stands as one of the four imposing gates, reflecting a blend of Islamic and Maratha architecture.

sources.snippet: A major landmark in Vadodara, the Mandvi Gate remains in the city as a powerful testimony to the celebrated Mughal era. It is a square-shaped pavilion that features three arched openings on every side. In the ancient days, the place was used as a toll gate for traders and merchants.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

sources.snippet: One of the most notable landmarks in Vadodara is Mandvi Gate, the north gate of the Royal Enclosure for the Baroda State. Its past dates back to the Mughal era. It is a four-story concrete building with an attached clock.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

places.name: Mandvi Gate

reviews.text: Mandvi Gate in Vadodara is a prominent heritage structure reflecting the city's rich Hindu architectural influence. Located in the old city, it stands tall amidst lively markets and traditional shops. This beautifully crafted gate was once a key central point and still holds cultural and historical importance. A must-visit for anyone exploring Vadodara's deep-rooted legacy.

A good architecture, but it is not maintained well . We cant get a proper photo of the gate as there is no photo point and traffic going around the gate. But if u r in baroda for the first time you can visit the place and the market near this place.
Mandvi Gate,Pani Gate and Nyay Mandir are the Gates in vadodara city.it is Main Market of vadodara as well.Thanks

places.address: Mandvi Cir, Sulemani Pol, Mandvi, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001, India

places.generalDescription: Baroda Museum & Picture Gallery, located within Sayaji Bagh, is a century-old museum and gallery displaying Asian and Middle Eastern paintings, sculptures, and weaponry. The museum features an extensive collection of artifacts related to archaeology, geology, natural history, personal collections of Maharaja Sayajirao III, and 109 miniature paintings from the Mughal era. The two-storied buildings are built in the Indo-Saracenic style of architecture.

sources.snippet: Chisholm designed around nine iconic landmarks of the city including M S University's arts faculty dome, Music College near Sursagar Lake, Female Training College, Nyay Mandir, Town Hall, Baroda Museum and Picture Gallery, Khanderao Market building, the Record Tower at Kothi and extension wing of Laxmi Vilas Palace," Joshi added. He said Chisholm also completed the work on Laxmi Vilas Palace after the death of its original architect Charles Mant. Joshi said Chisholm designed many projects in India during his stay here.
sources.shortName: Architect who gave Vadodara its character | Vadodara News

places.name: Baroda Museum & Picture Gallery

reviews.text: I visited the Baroda Museum and was left spellbound! The museum boasts an impressive collection of art, artifacts, and relics from various eras. The exhibits are well-curated and provide a fascinating glimpse into the region's rich history and culture. The museum's architecture itself is a work of art. A must-visit for history buffs and art enthusiasts.

Amazing historic and prehistoric artifacts to see. A good place to visit and understand the history of mankind. Do not forget to see the skeleton of the whale in the basement. Must watch. Unfortunately, photos are not allowed inside.
Must visit. To be honest one should visit this museum since it have japanese,Chinese,Egyptian and many musical related animal related and painting to be explore you will definitely love this

places.address: Kamatibaug, Dak Bunglaw, Sayajiganj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390020, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled across the Vishwamitra River and just a short stroll from Sayaji Baug, Kirti Mandir stands as an impressive tribute to the Gaekwad dynasty in Vadodara. This magnificent temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, was constructed in 1936 to honor Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III's Diamond Jubilee.

sources.snippet: Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III built Kirti Mandir, also known as the Temple of Fame, in 1936 as a memorial for the Gaekwad family. The structure, which has an exquisite architectural design, has several elegantly designed balconies, terraces, and tombs. The centrepiece of the attraction is a magnificently carved shikhara that rises to a height of 35 feet.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Kirti Mandir or the Temple of Fame is the cenotaph built for the members of the Baroda royal family. Situated near the Vishwamitri Bridge, it is an impressive structure complete with ornate carvings, balconies, terraces, and domes. You can find various murals adorning the walls of this structure that represent the battle of Mahabharata.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

places.name: Kirti Mandir

reviews.text: Kirti Mandir at night feels like stepping into a different world. The soft lighting gives the temple a glowing presence, and the calmness around makes it perfect for quiet reflection. Even though it's in the heart of the city, the atmosphere here is peaceful and soothing. A must-visit spot if you want to experience history, beauty, and serenity all at once.

Although the building itself still looks beautiful, it seems a little like an old palace. There is a Datta Mandir on one side and another temple in a relatively bad condition on the other side of the main building. Good place to click some pictures. But there wasn't much to see there since it was closed by the time we got there (around after 12 pm).

Kirti Mandir, located in Vadodara, is a stunning and unique temple that beautifully represents the architectural heritage of India. Built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III, it symbolizes the glory of the Gaekwad family and is often referred to as the "Temple of Fame."

The temple features intricate marble interiors adorned with beautifully carved sculptures depicting scenes from Indian mythology, including the Gangavataran, the life of Meera, and the battle of Mahabharat. The central hall is particularly impressive, showcasing the artistry that defines this heritage structure.

Visiting Kirti Mandir is a delightful experience, especially at night when the temple is illuminated with captivating lights, enhancing its beauty. The well-maintained gardens and lawns around the temple provide a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for family gatherings or quiet reflection.

Kirti Mandir is not only a place of worship but also a cultural gem that attracts visitors for its historical significance and architectural brilliance. Admission is free, and parking is readily available. Although it may be under renovation at times, its charm remains intact, making it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts and anyone seeking a peaceful escape from daily life. The temple's proximity to Sayaji Bagh adds to its appeal, providing a lovely area for leisurely walks and exploration.

places.address: Kothi Rd, Dak Bunglaw, Sayajiganj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390001, India

places.generalDescription: The EME Temple in Vadodara is a unique blend of modern architecture and ancient sculpture, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Constructed by the Indian Army, this contemporary temple features a geodesic dome covered with aluminum sheets, designed by renowned architect Gerard da Cunha. It has been under construction for over 25 years and incorporates aspects of major Indian religions.

sources.snippet: The EME Temple, devoted to Lord Shiva, is unique in style and concept thanks to its geodesic construction clad in aluminium sheets. The architecture of the EME Temple is a testament to secularism because it includes two domes, one devoted to Hinduism and the other to Islam. The Jain culture is represented by the two entrances, the Christian religion by the temple’s tower and the Buddhist religion by the tower’s gilded top.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Also known as the Dakshinamurty Temple, the EME Temple is a Shiva shrine managed by the Indian Army. The temple boasts of remarkable contemporary architecture featuring aspects of the major religions of India. Covered with aluminium sheets, the geodesic structure of the temple presents a striking sight.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

places.name: EME Temple

reviews.text:
A serene and peaceful haven! EME Temple is a beautiful blend of spirituality and natural beauty. The temple's architecture and surroundings are breathtakingly beautiful.
Note - If you're planning to visit here please carry physical copy of your Aadhar card.

The EME (Electrical and Mechanical Engineering) Temple, also known as the Dakshinamurthy Temple, is one of Vadodara's most unique and lesser-known attractions. Managed by the Indian Army, this temple is a fine blend of modern architecture, spiritual significance, and historical importance. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva, in his Dakshinamurthy form, symbolizing wisdom and enlightenment.

The EME Temple is a must-visit for those who appreciate unique architecture, spirituality, and peaceful surroundings. It's an excellent place for devotees, tourists, and history enthusiasts alike. Whether you are religious or not, the temple's ambience and design make it worth visiting at least once.

Architectural Significance:

The temple stands out with its geodesic dome structure, made of aluminium sheets, which is quite rare for a religious site. Designed with a futuristic approach, it incorporates elements from various religions:

The dome represents Islam

The tower (Shikhara) takes inspiration from Hindu temple architecture

The entrance resembles a Christian church

The golden structure inside symbolizes Buddhism

The grill work is inspired by Jain temples

EME Temple is q quiet nice and peaceful place depicting secularism of India. Each and every religion has its own role in our society which is depicted with five gates and symbols of Hinduism, Jainism, Islam, Christianity etc. very well.
All the idols from ancient times are also very very unique
We enjoyed thoroughly
Nav grah temple is a nearby rare temple.

places.address: 85JR+GPV, nr. EME TEMPLE, Fatehgunj, Vadodara, Gujarat 390002, India

places.generalDescription: Dipen Gada & Associates is an architecture firm based in Gujarat, India. They are known for their innovative and high-quality designs, and have completed projects across the state. Their work blends art and design elements to create beautiful and unique buildings. They offer a wide range of services, including interior design, planning, and construction.

sources.snippet: Despite having several treasures, modern Indian cities have lost their character as we have lost many heritage structures, points out Dipen Gada, principal designer and founder, Dipen Gada and Associates. He further says, “As a designer, I believe it is important to limit ourselves to certain fundamental materials that gives a palette to any city. The use of Aluminium Composite Panel is a big no for me as it has ruined architectural design and has a short longevity.
sources.shortName: Vadodara vibes: Architects from Gujarat gave interesting insights on the subject of preservation of local heritage & flavour in architecture

Our new house was designed by Mr. Chintan Shah, Arc-i Studio. His exceptional talent as both an architect and interior designer has transformed my house into a true masterpiece. His creativity and execution is just outstanding. The harmonious blend of architectural design and stunning interior elements was just perfect for the house. We have been working with Chintanbhai since 1 year. He listens your requirements and incorporate and suggest suitable solutions.

places.generalDescription: The Nandalay Temple in Vadodara is one of the most popular Hindu temples in the city. The temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna, and it is said that devotees are always blessed by Him. The temple also features a beautiful Rajbhog Prasadi, or offering ceremony, which is a great opportunity to get close to Lord Krishna.

sources.snippet: Also known as Nandalay Haveli, the Nandalay Temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna who is worshipped here as Shrinathji. The temple structure is decorated with ornate balconies and arches. The tastefully decorated interior complements the architectural beauty of the exterior.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

places.name: Nandalay Temple

reviews.text: Must visit to experience the Aarti and related ceremonies. Must try the raj bhog. It's a steal for the quality and quantity if food offered.
Attending the evening Arti and Raas is a spiritual experience every Hindu should take part in once

The Nandalay Temple is known for its stunning architecture and intricate craftsmanship. Its design incorporates elements from traditional Indian temple architecture while also introducing modern elements, making it a visually captivating structure. The temple's blend of traditional and contemporary design elements sets it apart from many other temples.

places.address: 8572+GX5, Rajesh Tower Rd, Divya Darshan Society, Gotri, Vadodara, Gujarat 390021, India

places.generalDescription: Khanderao Market Building, a landmark from 1906 in Vadodara city, Gujarat, is a bustling hub with clothing and food stalls set up in its garden. The market is popular for street photography and is one of the iconic landmarks of the city. It's part of a list of tourist attractions that draw visitors from around the world to Vadodara. The building was designed by Chisholm, who also worked on other significant structures in India during his time there.

sources.snippet: Chisholm designed around nine iconic landmarks of the city including M S University's arts faculty dome, Music College near Sursagar Lake, Female Training College, Nyay Mandir, Town Hall, Baroda Museum and Picture Gallery, Khanderao Market building, the Record Tower at Kothi and extension wing of Laxmi Vilas Palace," Joshi added. He said Chisholm also completed the work on Laxmi Vilas Palace after the death of its original architect Charles Mant. Joshi said Chisholm designed many projects in India during his stay here.
sources.shortName: Architect who gave Vadodara its character | Vadodara News

sources.snippet: To commemorate his region’s silver jubilee in 1906, Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad ll built the massive Khanderao Market complex. The building houses the fruit and vegetable market and the Vadodara Municipal Corporation’s offices (VMC). The building was the previous design work by renowned architect Robert Chisholm before he left for England.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Khanderao Market is a grand edifice that adorns the cityscape of Vadodara. Constructed by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906, the building boasts of impressive architecture. At present, the building houses several important government administrative offices.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

places.name: Khanderao Market Building

reviews.text: This market has been a part of my life for as long as I can remember! It's now my go-to place-I always find fresh veggies and fruits here at prices that are way more affordable than other markets. Shopping here just makes me happy!

Khanderao market is a palatial commercial building located on Chamaraja Road in Vadodara, Gujarat, in western India. It was erected by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906–07 as a gift to the city municipality to mark the silver jubilee of his administration. The offices of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation are located here.
The market was built by Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III in 1906–07 and named after his predecessor and adoptive father, Khanderao Gaekwad, Maharaja of Baroda (1856–1870). This market is a palatial commercial building located on Chamaraja Road in Vadodara, Gujarat, in western India. It was erected by the Maharaja as a gift to the city municipality to mark the silver jubilee of his administration. It was built at the cost of about ₹3 lakh (equivalent to ₹10.0 crore or US$1.2 million in 2023).

The market was designed in Indo-Saracenic style by English architect Robert Chisholm before his return to England. The two-storey building has two bays connected by an overhead passage with a large central dome rising to a height of 86 feet. Both bays are 70 feet long and 34 feet wide with a cloister around them. It is constructed from bricks and mortar and clad with Dhangdhra stones. The 16 stalls on the ground floor of the main building are occupied by municipal offices, while other stalls on two sides are used by 192 shops. The open courtyard between these two sides is 181 feet long and 156 feet wide and has a central junction.

The main gate takes inspiration from the gate of Dabhoi Fort, while the domes are inspired by Hindu temples and the arches are influenced by Islamic architecture. The perforated stone screens are similar to those of Agra.

The statue of Maharaja Khanderao placed in the courtyard was sculpted by Vinayak Pandurang Karmarkar and was inaugurated by Sayajirao Gaekwad III on December 23, 1935.

In the present day, the offices of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation are located here. Fresh vegetables, fruits, and flowers are sold within the market premises.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ | Khanderao Market Building (Moti Market)

We occasionally visit Khanderao Market Building, and it never disappoints. This market is a treasure trove, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits, vegetables, and flowers, both at wholesale and retail prices. The produce is always fresh, and the atmosphere is lively and vibrant.

One of the best parts about shopping here is interacting with the vendors-they are amazing! Their friendly nature and the bargaining system add to the fun of shopping. Additionally, the market offers everything needed for ritual activities, including Pooja items. Overall, a great place to experience the local culture and pick up high-quality goods. Highly recommended!

places.name: Saar Interior Design | Interior Designer In Vadodara | Best Interior Designers In Vadodara | Home Interior

reviews.text:
I had an incredible experience working with Mr. Hiren. A true professional with an exceptional eye for detail, he made the entire process seamless and stress-free. Mr. hiren was always available to provide guidance, offering strong, practical suggestions that balanced aesthetics with real-world usability.

What impressed me the most was the focus on creating designs that are not just visually stunning but also highly functional, ensuring every choice added value and utility. From material selection to the final execution, he hand-held through every step, making it a truly enjoyable journey. I highly recommend Saar Interior Design to anyone looking for thoughtful, elegant, and purposeful designs!

It was a wonderful experience working with Hiren & Dhara (Saar Interior Design). They are very creative and at the same time practical in their approach. Thanks to their efforts, our home has turned out to be a vibrant & cosy abode!

I just had my house's interior done by Hirenbhai and Dhara (Saar Interior Design Team), and I couldn't be happier with the results! What impressed me the most was their ability to truly understand my vision. They listened carefully to my ideas and preferences, and then translated them into a design that perfectly captured the aesthetic I was hoping for. The final design is exactly what I had in mind – even better, actually!

Not only are they great designers, but they also kept everything on schedule, which was a big plus. They were super organized and paid attention to every single detail. Seriously, they were there for everything, making sure it all went smoothly. If I had any questions or worries, they were always there to help. They didn't just finish the big stuff and disappear; they stayed until every little thing was perfect.

If you need an interior designer who's talented, reliable, and really cares about making you happy, I highly recommend Hirenbhai and Dhara. reviews.text: I had the pleasure of working with LAB A+U and I couldn't be happier with the results. The team was professional and attentive. They brought creative ideas to the table while making sure the space was functional and beautiful. The attention to detail was impeccable. The project was completed on time and within budget. I highly recommend LAB A+U for anyone looking to transform their space with expert design and high-quality service.

I recently visited a cafe designed by Lab A+U and was really impressed. Their attention to detail are top-notch, and the final design is both beautiful and functional. It's clear they take pride in their work, and I highly recommend them for anyone looking for quality architecture.

We had an amazing experience working with Anagha Joshi Lab A + U team creativity, attention to detail, and ability to turn our vision into reality exceeded our expectations. From the initial consultation to the final design, they were professional, responsive, and truly understood our needs.

Their innovative approach and expertise in sustainable design made our Zoi bistro by Nukkadpe project not only beautiful but also functional and efficient. Every step of the process was seamless, and they were always available to answer our questions and provide valuable insights.

places.generalDescription: Surya Narayan Temple, situated in Vadodara, Gujarat, is a significant Hindu temple dedicated to Surya Bhagwan. Nestled amidst the lush green surroundings of Surya Narayan Baug, this historical temple is renowned for its divine grace and healing properties. It is believed that a visit to this temple can provide relief from physical and mental ailments as well as alleviate unhappiness.

sources.snippet: The Surya Narayan Mandir is one of Vadodara’s most renowned temples. The Surya Narayan Baug area’s luscious greenery surrounds the shrine. This building is made of white limestone and decorated with beautiful ornamentation in the Nagara style.
sources.shortName: 15 Places to Visit in Vadodara for Travelling Architect

sources.snippet: Surya Narayan Temple | #5 of 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara. As the name indicates, the Surya Narayan Temple is dedicated to the Sun God or Surya Devta. Designed in a grand manner, the temple highlights majestic architectural features.
sources.shortName: 27 Best Places to Visit in Vadodara 2024, ✔Tourist Places List

reviews.text: Holy place. One of the Surya Temple. Temple is built 200 years ago. Temple is based on wheels which is not visible from front.

Overall, a pleasant and fulfilling experience.

reviews.text: Pomegranate Designs comes up with very innovative ideas. They give multiple options according to our requirements. Very neat work & they finished within time. They are very flexible with their designs and we are very happy with Samirs work! 😊

Pomegranate Designs, Vadodara is an excellent destination to build your dream houses and projects, providing innovative ideas, designs and meticulous planning.
Its founders, Samir Kulkarni and Sonal Kulkarni, are very much passionate, dedicated and creative for their work.
Under their guidance and support, it was a wonderful experience in building my home. I must say i have been lucky enough to have them as it would not have been possible without them.

Absolutely loved working with Samir & Sonal and their wonderful team. I was encouraged to share my ideas and needs. They took time to understand our preferences and helped us add our style to our home. They are professional yet they took personal interest in my project. They made sure that we were happy with our home and all necessities were in place before we moved in. We are so happy and we would recommend Pomegranate Designs to everyone who wants a trust worthy team with impeccable taste and positive attitude, who will work with you to create a perfect home.

places.generalDescription: Studio Yamini is a well-known interior architect office in Vadodara. They display a sensitivity towards the material, people, place and time which makes them one of the most popular architectural firms in town.

sources.snippet: Studio Yamini is a design oriented state-of-the-art architecture firm founded by architects Mehul Shah and Mitul Shah who had completed their bachelors in architecture from Institute of Environmental Design, Vallabh Vidyanagar in 2004. In their quest for implementing their vision into reality, Studio Yamini was conceived in the year 2004. Ever since its inception, it has grown to serve an increasingly diverse and extensive clientele in commercial, residential, retail spaces, corporate offices, educational , health care, boutiques/fashion stores, hotels and hospitality.
